topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the KVM Region Patch 3

body.p: This patch addresses a number of issues in the KVM region.

Note: You can use the Horizon UI to see if the patch has been deployed. Select the regionkvm, then click Admin, then System, and Inventory. Click the Patches table for the TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001_2.patch.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: You must install the KVM Region Custom Patch (HCG2.0_WR002_Patch005) and the PCI Bus Patch (HCG2.0_WR003_Patch007) before installing this patch.

body.section:
Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the file and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0003.patch and readme files are available.

section.title: Patch the standby controller
section.p: First log into the active cotroller, patch the standby controller, then make the standby active.

ol.li:
SSH into active controller in the KVM region.
For example: controller-0
Create a directory for the patch:mkdir -p /tmp/patches

Copy the following patch file to the /tmp/patches directory:
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0003.patch
Execute the following commands to upload the patch to the database: sudo sw-patch upload /tmp/patches/TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0003.patch
Execute the following commands to check if the patch is available for installation:sudo sw-patch query
Execute the following commands to check the Current state of all the hosts:sudo sw-patch query-hosts
Execute the following commands to apply the patch:sudo sw-patch apply TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0001_2.patch source /etc/nova/openrc

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-1 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-1
Wait until the standby controller comes up after patching.

Execute the following command to switch the active controller from the specified controller: system host-swact controller-#
For example, if the active controller is controller-0:system host-swact controller-0
This command makes controller-1 the active controller and makes controller-0 the standby.

section.title: Patch the new standby controller
section.p: Log onto the newly active controller and patch the standby controller.

ol.li:
SSH into the newly active controller.
For example: controller-1.

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-0 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-0

section.p: From the active controller, perform the following steps:

ol.li: Execute the following command to patch and reboot the compute-0: system host-patch-reboot compute-0
Execute the following command to patch and reboot compute-1: system host-patch-reboot compute-1
Apply the patch to any remaining compute nodes. You can use the check sudo sw-patch query-hosts command to verify that the patch is applied on all the hosts.
